content:
• Wednesday, August 24, 2011
  • AAPL

    Jobs resigns AAPL CEO post: What's next for investors? Will Apple warm up to deals? Is there no...

    Jobs resigns AAPL CEO post: What's next for investors? Will Apple warm up to deals? Is there no real replacement for a master magician? Even if a 5% selloff is just an emotional reaction to an inevitable event, keep an eye on linked companies like Softbank (OTCPK:SFTBY), and Toshiba (OTCPK:TOSBF), already active in Japan. Meanwhile, some $52B slipped out of the S&P 500's value after the announcement; e-mini futures now -0.3% (Analysts: Hold/Buy)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:49 PM
  • GES

    More on Guess (NYSE:GES): Q2 revenues were better than expected on strong sales internationally,...

    More on Guess (NYSE:GES): Q2 revenues were better than expected on strong sales internationally, but down 9.1% Y/Y, largely due to a settlement charge. The company lowers H2 and current quarter guidance below analysts' estimates due to a weakening global outlook. Shares -4.5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:06 PM | 1 Comment
  • STRA

    Strayer Education (NASDAQ:STRA) gained another +5.3% today after Sterne Agee upgraded the stock...

    Strayer Education (NASDAQ:STRA) gained another +5.3% today after Sterne Agee upgraded the stock to neutral on valuation. The stock has gained nearly 15% over the past two sessions on speculation that it will be bought out and taken private.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:11 PM
  • HRBN

    Harbin Electric (NASDAQ:HRBN) says it stands by its SEC filing and accuses a blogger attempting...

    Harbin Electric (NASDAQ:HRBN) says it stands by its SEC filing and accuses a blogger attempting to expose the firm of being a "short-seller." Shares fell 6.9% on the day.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:06 PM | 1 Comment
  • PSUN

    Pacific Sunwear (PSUN -32.2%) cratered today after reporting an in-line Q2, but warning that...

    Pacific Sunwear (PSUN -32.2%) cratered today after reporting an in-line Q2, but warning that losses will be greater-than-expected for the current quarter due to weak back-to-school sales.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:54 PM
  • AMAT

    More on Applied Materials' (NASDAQ:AMAT) FQ3 results: Orders declined 25% Q/Q, far outpacing a...

    More on Applied Materials' (NASDAQ:AMAT) FQ3 results: Orders declined 25% Q/Q, far outpacing a 2.4% revenue decline. The decline was driven by a 28% drop in Silicon Systems (chip equipment) orders, a 14% drop in Display orders, and a 48% drop in Energy and Environmental Solutions orders (solar a large %). AMAT -4.2% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:43 PM
  • SIGA

    SIGA Technologies (NASDAQ:SIGA) closed with a +7.3% gain after the company says it's been...

    SIGA Technologies (NASDAQ:SIGA) closed with a +7.3% gain after the company says it's been awarded a $7.7M grant from the NIH to develop an antiviral drug to treat a variety of hemorrhagic fevers.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM
  • Z

    Zillow (NASDAQ:Z): Q2 EPS of $0.00 in first report as a publicly traded company. Revenue of...

    Zillow (NASDAQ:Z): Q2 EPS of $0.00 in first report as a publicly traded company. Revenue of $15.8M (+115% Y/Y). Shares +2.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:35 PM

  • More on TiVo's Q2 report: Service revenue falls 5% (Y/Y). Technology revenue increases 143%...

    More on TiVo's Q2 report: Service revenue falls 5% (Y/Y). Technology revenue increases 143% (Y/Y). Calls out intellectual property of 210 issued patents and 389 pending applications as "significantly advanced." Issues Q3 revenue guidance at $49M-$51M vs. $49.6M consensus. Shares +8% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM
  • PSS

    More on Collective Brands (NYSE:PSS): Easily beats Q2 estimates, but shares are soaring after...

    More on Collective Brands (NYSE:PSS): Easily beats Q2 estimates, but shares are soaring after the board says it will conduct "a review of strategic and financial alternatives," including a possible sale. Shares +30% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM
  • MAR

    Starwood Hotels & Resorts (HOT +5.2%) and MGM (MGM +10.7%) close higher after Bernstein says...

    Starwood Hotels & Resorts (HOT +5.2%) and MGM (MGM +10.7%) close higher after Bernstein says demand from high-end consumers is holding up and both companies are likely to beat earnings estimates.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:22 PM

  • More on PSS Q2 report: Close approx. 475 inefficient stores in next three years with more than...

    More on PSS Q2 report: Close approx. 475 inefficient stores in next three years with more than 300 to be closed by the end of FY11. 4,839 stores at the end of Q2. Sees FQ3 PLG wholesale sales to increase more than 20% Y/Y. Sees FY11 Capex at $105M, D&A at $135M. 4,552 stores at the end of FY11. Shares +33.1% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:19 PM
  • AMAT

    Applied Materials (NASDAQ:AMAT): FQ3 EPS of $0.35 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $2.8B (-2.4% Y/Y)...

    Applied Materials (NASDAQ:AMAT): FQ3 EPS of $0.35 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $2.8B (-2.4% Y/Y) beats by $0.1B. Sees FQ4 Net sales down in the range of $1.96B-$2.38B (decrease by 15%-30% Q/Q), Non-GAAP EPS at $0.16-$0.24 vs. consensus of $0.33. Shares -3.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM
  • PSS

    Collective Brands (NYSE:PSS): Q2 EPS of $0.16 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $882M (+5% Y/Y) beats...

    Collective Brands (NYSE:PSS): Q2 EPS of $0.16 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $882M (+5% Y/Y) beats by $16M. Shares +28.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM
  • BELFA

    Bel Fuse (BELFA +11.7%) and Power-One (PWER +1.5%) both finished higher today, after saying they...

    Bel Fuse (BELFA +11.7%) and Power-One (PWER +1.5%) both finished higher today, after saying they intend to appeal the judgment in their SynQor patent infringement case.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • RDN

    Radian Group (RDN +22%) rises on reports that its Chairman Herbert Wender bought 50,000 shares.

    Radian Group (RDN +22%) rises on reports that its Chairman Herbert Wender bought 50,000 shares.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM
  • ANDV

    Tesoro (TSO +5.6%) gains after Benchmark ups the shares to buy, saying its midcycle earnings...

    Tesoro (TSO +5.6%) gains after Benchmark ups the shares to buy, saying its midcycle earnings outlook has significantly improved and the company is likely to reinstate annual dividends in 2012.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 PM
  • NYT

    Turns out Carlos Slim made two purchases of New York Times (NYT +5.7%) stock, boosting his stake...

    Turns out Carlos Slim made two purchases of New York Times (NYT +5.7%) stock, boosting his stake in the publisher to 7.5% Friday following a larger share purchase the day before, totaling more than 1M shares in one week. Why the sudden buying spree? It's cheap. Slim also upped his stake in Saks (SKS +3.2%) to 16.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 PM
  • MFLX

    Shares of thinly-traded Multi-Fineline Electronix (MFLX +2.2%) get a boost with an initiation...

    Shares of thinly-traded Multi-Fineline Electronix (MFLX +2.2%) get a boost with an initiation from Rodman & Renshaw at Outperform with a PT of $22. The company looks to break its stereotype with investors as a RIMM-only (RIMM +3.6%) supplier.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:21 PM
  • AGN

    More on Allergan (AGN +2.4%): Shares started trading higher yesterday in advance of today's...

    More on Allergan (AGN +2.4%): Shares started trading higher yesterday in advance of today's announcement the firm's BOTOX solution was approved by the FDA.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:06 PM
  • NDAQ

    Nasdaq OMX Group (NDAQ +1.8%) is higher after UBS upgrades the shares, saying the stock is...

    Nasdaq OMX Group (NDAQ +1.8%) is higher after UBS upgrades the shares, saying the stock is trading at a deep discount to earnings and its "defensive business mix" should do well in a potential downturn.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM
  • MU

    Demand for DRAM could continue to fall "for another quarter or two" amid a soft...

    Demand for DRAM could continue to fall "for another quarter or two" amid a soft PC environment, Micron (MU -7.3%) CEO Steve Appleton says, sending shares skidding most on the S&P. While the stock currently is hurt by its ties to DRAM, Appleton says investors eventually will realize the industry is getting better at managing supply and demand.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:33 PM | 1 Comment
  • SIX

    Amusement park operators Six Flags (SIX +2.1%) and Cedar Fair (FUN +3.2%) are both higher on...

    Amusement park operators Six Flags (SIX +2.1%) and Cedar Fair (FUN +3.2%) are both higher on renewed speculation attendance numbers will be stronger-than-expected for the summer. Also positioned to benefit are Disney (DIS +0.5%) and Comcast (CMCSA +1.7%), both gainers for the day.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:24 PM | 1 Comment
  • HQCL

    Chinese solar-products maker Hanwha SolarOne (HSOL -4.6%) takes a hit today after its Q2 missed...

    Chinese solar-products maker Hanwha SolarOne (HSOL -4.6%) takes a hit today after its Q2 missed estimates. Revenue swung to a loss as margins were impacted by much higher than anticipated operating expenses. The company also warns that H2 shipments will be at the lower end of guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:19 PM

  • Comex trading closed with gold plummeting more than $100/oz., or 5.6%, to $1757.30 in its...

    Comex trading closed with gold plummeting more than $100/oz., or 5.6%, to $1757.30 in its biggest one-day percentage drop since March 2008. Investors took profits amid doubts whether the Fed will unveil any steps to prop up the U.S. economy; there are also fears of new margin requirement increases. Silver, platinum and palladium also plunge.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM | 4 Comments
  • FTEK

    Pollution control engineering firm Fuel Tech (FTEK +3.4%) holds on to its gains in the afternoon...

    Pollution control engineering firm Fuel Tech (FTEK +3.4%) holds on to its gains in the afternoon session, having jumped higher on the announcement of a $6M stock buyback earlier today.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:49 PM
  • BB

    Research In Motion (RIMM) is up 2.9% after reports that the QNX phones it's introducing early...

    Research In Motion (RIMM) is up 2.9% after reports that the QNX phones it's introducing early next year will run apps made for Android (NASDAQ:GOOG). At 250K apps, the Android Market is roughly six times the size of RIM's own app store.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:39 PM
  • GLD

    The decline in gold is accelerating, with the metal now down more than $100/oz. at $1,756, a...

    The decline in gold is accelerating, with the metal now down more than $100/oz. at $1,756, a 5.4% move. GLD -3.6%. The ETF looks better than the metal because GLD declined a bit in the afternoon yesterday after gold's main session ended.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:24 PM | 3 Comments
  • NYT

    The New York Times (NYSE:NYT) gains 5.1% after Carlos Slim announces he's increased his stake in...

    The New York Times (NYSE:NYT) gains 5.1% after Carlos Slim announces he's increased his stake in the company to 7.3% from 6.9%, just a month after the Times paid off a $250M loan provided by Slim. Though the Times insists Slim isn't interested in running the company, there's been plenty of speculation on the subject.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:23 PM
  • ATPAQ

    Shares of ATP Oil & Gas (ATPG +6.2%) get a boost this morning, after the driller says it's...

    Shares of ATP Oil & Gas (ATPG +6.2%) get a boost this morning, after the driller says it's successfully brought online the well at its Telemark Hub location in the deep-water Gulf of Mexico after a 16 month delay.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:10 PM
  • AGN

    Allergan (AGN +2.5%) shares jump following news that the FDA approves Botox to treat urinary...

    Allergan (AGN +2.5%) shares jump following news that the FDA approves Botox to treat urinary incontinence in people with neurologic conditions such as spinal cord injury and multiple sclerosis who have overactivity of the bladder.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:02 PM
  • BAC

    Add Raymond James to the list of Bank of America's (BAC +7.6%) defenders. Analyst Anthony Polini...

    Add Raymond James to the list of Bank of America's (BAC +7.6%) defenders. Analyst Anthony Polini says in a note that the selloff has gotten out of hand. "Recent news items have been as absurd as any we've seen in many years," he writes. The company has "more than enough capital to put the mortgage mess behind it without issuing a single new common share."
     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM | 1 Comment
  • DY

    Dycom Industries (DY +8.5%) is higher today after its FQ4 easily beat estimates. Earnings more...

    Dycom Industries (DY +8.5%) is higher today after its FQ4 easily beat estimates. Earnings more than doubled on increased sales and an improved bottom line, due in large part to the absence of one-time charges which frequently skew the company's margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:40 PM
  • LDK

    S&P places LDK Solar (LDK -2.7%) on review for a possible downgrade from its current B+...

    S&P places LDK Solar (LDK -2.7%) on review for a possible downgrade from its current B+ rating after the solar concern cut its outlook for Q2 and FY11.The ratings agency says it will finish the review within the next 3 months.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:36 PM
  • D

    Shares of Dominion Resources (D +1.5%) gain after the firm says the North Anna Power Station is...

    Shares of Dominion Resources (D +1.5%) gain after the firm says the North Anna Power Station is no longer relying on back-up generators following the 5.8-magnitude earthquake. According to the NRC, 12 nuclear power plants in the U.S. declared "unusual events," a level considered the lowest emergency designation.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM
  • PRX

    Par Pharmaceutical (PRX +5%) agrees to acquire privately held Anchen Pharmaceuticals for $410M...

    Par Pharmaceutical (PRX +5%) agrees to acquire privately held Anchen Pharmaceuticals for $410M in cash, a move that will boost the generic drug maker's current pipeline and add to its R&D capabilities.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM
  • INN

    Summit Hotel Properties (INN +9.1%) pops on a valuation upgrade from KeyBanc, saying the...

    Summit Hotel Properties (INN +9.1%) pops on a valuation upgrade from KeyBanc, saying the majority of its customers are business transient travelers that will continue to travel and utilize the company's hotels, even in a slowing economy.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM
  • SNTS

    Shares of DepoMed gain 5.7%, helped along with insider buying from the firm's CEO. Earlier this...

    Shares of DepoMed gain 5.7%, helped along with insider buying from the firm's CEO. Earlier this week, the specialty pharmaceutical company announced a new agreement with Santarus (SNTS +1.4%) to market its Glumetza diabetes treatment.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM
  • SANM

    RBC Capital Markets downgrades two OEM suppliers this morning, cutting Sanmina (SANM -5.5%) to...

    RBC Capital Markets downgrades two OEM suppliers this morning, cutting Sanmina (SANM -5.5%) to underperform and Benchmark Electronics (BHE -5.7%) to sector perform on slower overall technology chain demand and expectations for a "muted" second half.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM
  • INN

    Summit Hotel Properties (INN +11.8%), an operator of premium hotel franchises, is recovering...

    Summit Hotel Properties (INN +11.8%), an operator of premium hotel franchises, is recovering some of its August losses after KeyBanc's Dennis Frost upgrades shares to Buy. Frost thinks Summit is relatively immune from weak middle-class consumer spending, given that most of its customers are "short-stay business travelers."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM
  • MGM

    Shares of MGM Resorts (MGM +9.7%) recover nicely after a 5-day downward trend that followed news...

    Shares of MGM Resorts (MGM +9.7%) recover nicely after a 5-day downward trend that followed news investor Kirk Kerkorian plans to unload a gigantic stake in the company. The stock is down 36% in the last month, compared to an decline of 15% for casino stocks (BJK -1.2%) in the same period.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM
  • BAC

    In an internal memo, Bank of America (BAC +9.4%) calls rumors of a merger with JPMorgan...

    In an internal memo, Bank of America (BAC +9.4%) calls rumors of a merger with JPMorgan (NYSE:JPM) "baseless." The bank also tells its crew it has no need to raise capital by issuing additional common stock.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:27 AM | 5 Comments
  • VLTR

    Analog chipmaker Volterra (NASDAQ:VLTR) is down 7.7%, as Collins Stewart lowers its estimates...

    Analog chipmaker Volterra (NASDAQ:VLTR) is down 7.7%, as Collins Stewart lowers its estimates for the company. Collins Stewart thinks the delayed rollout of Intel's (NASDAQ:INTC) Romley server platform will hurt Volterra, just as it's hurting fellow analog vendor Inphi (IPHI -28.5%). (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM
  • RRTS

    Roadrunner Transportation Systems (RRTS +9.6%) jumps after agreeing to buy privately held Prime...

    Roadrunner Transportation Systems (RRTS +9.6%) jumps after agreeing to buy privately held Prime Logistics in a cash-and-stock deal valued at over $97M million.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM
  • SPGI

    McGraw-Hill (MHP +5.3%) shares move up on fresh breakup talk, as Bloomberg states the case that...

    McGraw-Hill (MHP +5.3%) shares move up on fresh breakup talk, as Bloomberg states the case that the textbook publisher and S&P owner would be worth at least 40% more if split into pieces. MHP has “value that isn’t being reflected in the market," Michael Holland says. "The CEO and the board have to consider [a breakup] if they want to unlock value." (earlier)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:10 AM | 1 Comment
  • ZGNX

    Specialty pharmaceutical company Zogenix (ZGNX -4.7%) is lower this morning after announcing a...

    Specialty pharmaceutical company Zogenix (ZGNX -4.7%) is lower this morning after announcing a 12M share secondary offering to raise funds for bringing its new drug candidate Zohydro to market.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM
  • GOLD

    Gold and silver miners are among the day's big losers as the metals undergo a round of...

    Gold and silver miners are among the day's big losers as the metals undergo a round of profit-taking. ABX -4%. GG -4.7%. AUQ -5.2%. JAG -6.8%. EXK -7%. SLW -4.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM
  • SINA

    Sina (SINA -5.1%) is moving lower after the company received a veiled warning from a Communist...

    Sina (SINA -5.1%) is moving lower after the company received a veiled warning from a Communist Party Politburo member to "put an end to fake and misleading information" on its Twitter-like Weibo microblogging service.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM | 1 Comment
  • SYNO

    Synovis Life Technologies (SYNO +4.5%) trades higher this morning after its FQ3 beat estimates....

    Synovis Life Technologies (SYNO +4.5%) trades higher this morning after its FQ3 beat estimates. Revenues were a record $21M, jumping 20% Y/Y as the small medical-device company racks up double-digit sales growth on strong demand for its Peri-Strips products.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM
  • GLD

    Gold continues to plummet - at $1,780/oz., it's $135 or 7% below its peak hit just 36 hours ago....

    Gold continues to plummet - at $1,780/oz., it's $135 or 7% below its peak hit just 36 hours ago. News that central banks - typically traders one might fade - are net buyers of the metal for the first time in a generation may give gold bulls some pause. GLD -2.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM | 1 Comment
  • KNX

    Shares of Swift Transportation (SWFT +12.5%) soar on heavy volume after the firm announces a new...

    Shares of Swift Transportation (SWFT +12.5%) soar on heavy volume after the firm announces a new freight container service running between the U.S. and Mexico. The stock is still off 50% over the last 2 months. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM
  • AZPN

    Aspen Technology (NASDAQ:AZPN), a developer of software for optimizing manufacturing processes,...

    Aspen Technology (NASDAQ:AZPN), a developer of software for optimizing manufacturing processes, is up 15.2% after reporting FQ4 revenue of $52.6M (+38% Y/Y) and EPS of -$0.20, beating consensus by $5.1M and $0.02. Free cash flow was $9.6M, and the total value of the company's contracts grew 7% Q/Q to $1.42B. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM
  • TOL

    Shares of Toll Brothers (TOL +3.6%) move higher after the firm delivers a Q2 earnings beat on...

    Shares of Toll Brothers (TOL +3.6%) move higher after the firm delivers a Q2 earnings beat on lower revenue. The homebuilder only increased new orders from its affluent buyers by 2% in the last quarter, but the CEO says sales are "gaining traction."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM | 1 Comment
  • GSM

    Globe Specialty Metals (NASDAQ:GSM), a maker of silicon metal and alloys, is down 8% after...

    Globe Specialty Metals (NASDAQ:GSM), a maker of silicon metal and alloys, is down 8% after reporting FQ4 results. While revenue of $175.9M (+20% Y/Y) beat consensus by $9.2M, EPS of $0.28 (exc. one-time charges) missed by $0.03. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM
  • HEINY

    More casualties from Heineken's (HINKY.PK) sales warning crop up in early trading. Shares of...

    More casualties from Heineken's (HINKY.PK) sales warning crop up in early trading. Shares of Molson Coors (TAP -1.1%), Ambev (ABV -1.6%) and Willamette Valley Vineyards (WVVI -5.8%) join lynchpin Anheuser-Busch Inbev (BUD -3.8%) in a wide sector selloff.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 AM
  • BAC

    Bank of America lowers forecasts and price targets for the too-big-to-fail bank stocks, citing...

    Bank of America lowers forecasts and price targets for the too-big-to-fail bank stocks, citing "magnified seasonal decline due to heightened volatility, which has been particularly difficult to manage following S&P U.S. debt downgrade." Banks (XLF +2%) moving higher in early trade: BAC +8.2%, JPM +2.3%, C +3.2%, GS +2.2%, MS +2.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM
  • AEO

    American Eagle Outfitters (NYSE:AEO) falls 8.5% premarket after lowering its FY11 EPS estimate...

    American Eagle Outfitters (NYSE:AEO) falls 8.5% premarket after lowering its FY11 EPS estimate to $0.85-$0.95, from earlier guidance of $1.02. The retailer has seen declining same-store sales, but a Janney analyst says back-to-school foot traffic is brisk.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:28 AM
  • AVGO

    Premarket gainers: AVGO +11%. RENN +12%. ATPG +10%. ELN +5%. CPST +4%.Losers: PSUN -22%. UTHR...

    Premarket gainers: AVGO +11%. RENN +12%. ATPG +10%. ELN +5%. CPST +4%.
    Losers: PSUN -22%. UTHR -21%. HSOL -10%. TCAP-OLD -8%. AEO -7%. HGSI -7%. BUD -4%. TTM -4%. LPL -4%. BCS -4%. AUO -3%. STD -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • CVS

    CVS Caremark (NYSE:CVS) announces a $4B stock buyback program on top of an earlier $2B buyback....

    CVS Caremark (NYSE:CVS) announces a $4B stock buyback program on top of an earlier $2B buyback. The drugstore operator says it will repurchase at least $1B in stock by the end of the year. Shares +2.1% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM
  • UTHR

    United Therapeutics (NASDAQ:UTHR) falls sharply after disclosing its late-stage drug for...

    United Therapeutics (NASDAQ:UTHR) falls sharply after disclosing its late-stage drug for pulmonary arterial hypertension failed to improving walking distance for patients. The firm says it will still move forward to seek FDA approval based on an earlier positive study. Shares down 21% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:45 AM

  • U.S. stock futures erase losses and European shares shoot higher in the wake of the strong...

    U.S. stock futures erase losses and European shares shoot higher in the wake of the strong durable goods report. S&P 500 -0.1%. Stoxx 50 +1.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:36 AM
  • ELN

    Elan (NYSE:ELN) is up 5.2% premarket after Credit Suisse weighs in with an upgrade to Outperform...

    Elan (NYSE:ELN) is up 5.2% premarket after Credit Suisse weighs in with an upgrade to Outperform from Neutral.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:14 AM
  • RENN

    Shares of Renren (NYSE:RENN) soar 14% premarket after the earlier announcement the company will...

    Shares of Renren (NYSE:RENN) soar 14% premarket after the earlier announcement the company will work closely with MSN China (NASDAQ:MSFT).

     
     
     
     
    | 8:07 AM
